page.title: 12Finedon The Waendel Walk
page.content: The Waendel Walk is an International Event recognised by the I.V.V. and takes place over 2 days in June.Walkers have a choice of three distances 9km, 18km or 26km on each day.Some walkers compete on both days.The Waendel Walkers Club formed in 1981 meets at the Bell Inn in Finedon. Much of the second days course is on footpaths and minor roads around Finedon.In 1985,the 7th Waendel Walk, 3082 people took part.Some came from as far apart as Europe,U.S.A.,New Zealand and Singapore. There are trophies for various group entries and medals for individuals who complete the course. Waendel was a Saxon who settled in the area 1400 years ago and Wellingborough the starting point of the walks was named after him.
